page.title: 08FEN CURES AND SUPERSTITIONS
page.content:
In the{fens}people{believed}in, and did some unusual things to{cure {illneses.} Many people had{rheumatism,}one cure was to get a{spider}and eat it alive in a pastry package, or hang one around the neck.To keep{evil spirits {away, Bluntisham}people often tied a red ribbon around their leg. For{Fen {Ague,}a type of flu, people carried a mole{or hare's foot,}around with them. {Slugs}were hung on nails in rooms to charm and get rid of{warts,}the slugs were first wiped on the warts then pinned up.This is still done today. People also often stole some{meat}and wiped their warts with it and{buried} the meat.As the meat decayed it was supposed to make the{warts vanish.}
( By Elizabeth Eddy aged 10 years)
